reviewText: The quality of this particular recording is better than many considering.

Well, I don't know exactly where to start. It's an amazing movie  technically speaking , especially for the time that it was made.  The special effects are really good considering it was the early 1900s.  Big surprise ending. I didn't see that coming.  Buy it. Watch it. Be amazed
Have not yet watched it but assume it's good.
Very disappointed with the movie.  Had no idea it was a silent picture.  Was expecting something so much better.

If you have any doubts about how true this movie is, please read "Hampton and his Red Shirts," written by Alfred B. Williams. Mr Williams was a reporter during reconstruction in South Carolina. His book was written in 1935 before Political Correctness,Deconstructionism,Poststructuralism,Moderism,Minimalism and Academic Collectivism, the reason I read  books wrote during the time the story was taking place.

A technical evaluation here - I'm a bid disappointed in that this remaster isn't as good as could have been. When a title comes up on the screen, it shakes and there's dust marks in the picture. A good restoration would have used a cleaned up title still, and cut or dissolved to it. There are also deshaker programs out there that make a shaking video solid with no movement. This was not done.
